algorithm
Class QMCAlgorithm

java.lang.Object
  algorithm.QMCAlgorithm

public class QMCAlgorithm
extends java.lang.Object

This class provides the main part of the QuineMcKluskey-algorithm.
We merge the monons to get new monoms or to add them to the remaining set.

Author:
chrissy

Field Detail

workingSet

public MonomPowerSet workingSet
This is the whole Powerset of monoms the QMC is working on. It contains all original and merged monoms.

maxSign

protected int maxSign
Calculated the maximum number of different (set)signatures which is 2^(maxIndex-1)

signatures

protected java.lang.String[] signatures
provides an signature-array to store all possible different signatures

sortedSignatures

protected java.lang.String[] sortedSignatures
This array is sorted downward to the number of signatures. This means for the length of 5 we begin with sortedSignatures[0] = XXXXX ... ... and end with sortedSignatures[length-1] = ----- We add some description inside the array which can be deleted in future

monomlistj

protected java.util.TreeSet<Monom> monomlistj
these are two iterators storing the monoms of j and j+1 1s.

monomlistjPlus1

protected java.util.TreeSet<Monom> monomlistjPlus1

melted

protected MonomList melted
Now we provide two lists for the resulting monoms. One list for the new merged monoms and the other for the rest of the monoms where the monoms couldn't be paired.

unPaired

protected MonomList unPaired

PrimF

protected MonomList PrimF
This is the list of the Primimplicants which are left over after each melting process

constructSignatureStrings

constructSignatureSort

public void constructSignatureSort()
We organize the order of signatures that should be merged; see below now we need to decide for which signatures we use the core of this algorithm. In the case of length 5 we remark that
the first signature is

(starting order)
XXXXX
Then followed by
XXXX-,XXX-X,XX-XX,X-XXX,-XXXX
....
up until to
....
----X,---X-,--X--,-X---,X----
and finally
-----
(ending order)

Note that after each iteration we need to collect all merged monoms and all unpaired monoms. For this we've created the get-Methods. Hence we also need to choose the correct order of signatures.

This method sorts the constructed signatures in decreasing order by the number of there entries. Thus for length 5 begin with

XXXXX
...
...
end with
-----

between we put some descriptions in like

2 entries (in the case of length 5)
-X-X-
---XX

therfore the sortarray-index is maxIndex bigger than the normal string array.

countEntries

protected int countEntries(java.lang.String signature)
counts the entries 'X' of one signature, deleted entries '-' are ignored.

Parameters:
signature - count the entries of this signature
Returns:
the number of entries

getSignaturesWithNEntries

public java.util.TreeSet<java.lang.String> getSignaturesWithNEntries(int n)
Parameters:
n - number of entries
Returns:
a TreeSet of signatures which have exactly n entries

listMergingSets

protected void listMergingSets()
This method lists the current merging sets to the outStream. Attention: the current merging sets are dependent on the coreOfQMC.

melt

protected Monom melt(Monom m1,
                     Monom m2)
This method merges two monoms m1, m2 and set them "paired" iff the merging-process was successful.

Parameters:
m1 - first monom
m2 - second monom
Returns:
the merged monom - null iff the two monoms couldn't be merged

collectUnpaired

protected void collectUnpaired(MonomOnesSubset mos)
This method collects all unpaired Monoms of the QMC-Algorithm.
Note: Only use it after coreOfQMC

Parameters:
mos -

coreOfQMC

protected void coreOfQMC(java.lang.String signature)
This is the core-algorithm of QuniceMcKluskey.
It runs on one signature of monoms.

Parameters:
signature - the signature the core algorithm runs on

reportPrimF

reports the set PrimF to the Latex- and Report-file.

run

public void run()
This method performs one complete run of the QuineMcKluskey-Algorithm.
We execute this algorithm according to the sortedSignatures' order.
Hence we start with

XXXXX
XXXX-,XXX-X,XX-XX,X-XXX,-XXXX
...
until
-----

the sortedSingatures-array is already ordered by the init -method

reportLists

public void reportLists()

completeAlgorithm

public static void completeAlgorithm(MonomList ml)
after one execution of the QMC-Algortihm:
We have the meltedList as the List we want to work on. And we have the unpairedList which is the list of the remaining Primimplicants Prim(f)

Parameters:
args -
